item.title: Bargain of the century
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:21, topic:294694”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=389755.msg2910959#msg2910959 date=1250095127]

You can sue for false advertising if you don’t.

i call bs
[/quote]

I’m fairly sure in the UK, if an item is marked wrong it is false advertising, and they have to sell it at that price, but I’m also sure they can refuse to sell it.[/quote]
This.

(I live in the UK)

Read full topic

item.title: Bargain of the century
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:24, topic:294694”]A store disclaimer doesn’t override the law. Chances are if someone took them to court they would win, but court costs and lawyer fees would add up to more than the tv is worth anyway.[/quote]Not if you ordered more than one, like alot of people did.

Read full topic

item.title: Bargain of the century
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

A store disclaimer doesn’t override the law. Chances are if someone took them to court they would win, but court costs and lawyer fees would add up to more than the tv is worth anyway.

item.title: Bargain of the century
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Many of these companies have in their terms and conditions that if a product is mispriced, their order will be cancelled. Amazon do the same, they put up GT5 for £18 on pre order, but then after thousands of people pre ordered it, they cancelled all the orders saying it was a mistake.

Read full topic

item.title: Bargain of the century
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:21, topic:294694”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=389755.msg2910959#msg2910959 date=1250095127]

You can sue for false advertising if you don’t.

i call bs
[/quote]

I’m fairly sure in the UK, if an item is marked wrong it is false advertising, and they have to sell it at that price, but I’m also sure they can refuse to sell it.[/quote]
They can remove it from sale but the items that have already been bought have to be shipped.

Atleast thats my understanding on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Bargain of the century
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:18, topic:294694”][quote author=Holic link=topic=389755.msg2911595#msg2911595 date=1250127306]

They have the law on their side, they clearly says errors like that could occur.
All know that you don’t get a tv for $10.

Hot coffee is hot, but if it doesn’t say it and that person gets burnt, lawsuit.
Common sense doesn’t apply to law.
[/quote]
Forgot American law is BULLSHIT, even Russia is better.
In all Europe you would not get anyway with that lawsuit, except on failblog.
Been a similar things here, the costumers got a discount but not the item for that price.
If the wrong price seams realistic (Like 20% cheaper) they have to give it to you for that price.[/quote]

NO

Read full topic

item.description:
@haticks wrote:

You can sue for false advertising if you don’t.
[/quote]

i call bs[/quote]You would think so wouldn’t you…
http://www.tendollarhdtv.com/

If you know of a lawyer, that is willing to take up a case such as the one we have here, in true class action lawsuit style, please post his information. I am sure tons are going to become available, but we all want one who has been proven to show positive results to his clients!
